seo.title: Veo 3.1 Fast (4‚Äì8s, 1080p) ‚Äî Specs, Pricing & Optional Audio
seo.description: Veo 3.1 Fast: generate 4‚Äì8s clips in 720p/1080p from text or images with optional audio. Compare per-second pricing vs full Veo 3.1 and generate via wallet worldwide.

overview: Veo 3.1 Fast is the speed-and-cost tier of the Veo family: 4‚Äì8s clips, 720p/1080p, text or image input, framing/tone presets, optional native audio, and per-second pricing for rapid testing.

hero.title: Veo 3.1 Fast ‚Äì High-Speed AI Video with Optional Audio
hero.intro: Lower-cost 4‚Äì8s cinematic clips in 720p/1080p ‚Äî optional audio for quick volume testing.

promptStructure.title: Text-to-Video with Veo 3.1 Fast
promptStructure.quote: Misty forest at dawn, medium shot centered on a mossy rock. Camera slowly pushes forward as soft rays of light appear between the trees, 6 seconds, 16:9 at 1080p. Audio: gentle birds and wind, no dialogue.
promptStructure.description: Keep prompts tight, single-scene and sensory. Aim to A/B ideas quickly with minimal changes between variants.
steps: Subject + focal point (one idea for the whole clip)
Light and mood (daylight, neon night, warm office, etc.)
Audio (optional): ambience + short VO, or say ‚Äúno dialogue‚Äù

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: ‚ö° Use Fast as a sandbox for A/B tests and prompt tweaks
üéöÔ∏è Audio toggle: rough mix when on, cheaper runs when off
üì± Optimize for social formats where 4‚Äì8 seconds is the story
üñºÔ∏è Single-scene focus; avoid multi-location narratives in this tier
üîÅ Clone winners to Veo 3.1 for final 1080p polish and richer audio

prompts.title: Misty forest slow push
prompts.prompt: Misty forest at dawn, slow push-in toward a mossy rock as light rays cut through trees, subtle birdsong, no dialogue, 8s, 16:9 at 1080p.

prompts.title: Vertical late-night desk loop
prompts.prompt: 6s 9:16 loop of a young woman working late at a minimalist desk, city lights blurred behind her. Slow handheld drift left/right, cool blue window light plus warm desk lamp, quiet typing + city hum, no dialogue.

faqs.q: When should I use Veo 3.1 Fast instead of Veo 3.1?
faqs.a: Use Fast for exploration, social variants and internal reviews; switch to Veo 3.1 for final hero shots and paid media.

faqs.q: Does Veo 3.1 Fast support vertical videos?
faqs.a: Yes. Veo 3.1 Fast supports 16:9 and 9:16 at 720p or 1080p; choose 9:16 for mobile-first placements.

faqs.q: Can I reuse Veo 3.1 prompts in Fast?
faqs.a: Yes. Clone a Veo 3.1 render, change engine to Veo 3.1 Fast, keep framing/tone presets, and adjust length/resolution.

faqs.q: How does pricing compare to Veo 3.1?
faqs.a: Fast runs are cheaper per second (e.g., ~$0.15/s audio on, ~$0.10/s audio off) so you can try multiple variants before upgrading.

faqs.q: Can I run Veo 3.1 Fast from Europe or LATAM?
faqs.a: Yes. It uses the same MaxVideoAI wallet/workspace and licensed DeepMind routing‚Äîno separate billing needed.

custom.heroDesc1: Veo 3.1 Fast brings DeepMind‚Äôs cinematic engine to a lower price point and faster turnaround‚Äîperfect for rapid testing and social loops.
custom.heroDesc2: Start from a short text brief or a single reference image, pick 4/6/8 seconds, choose 16:9 or 9:16, toggle audio, and generate clips fast enough to A/B multiple ideas in one session.
custom.heroSupportLine: Best for exploring hooks, angles, and pacing fast before you regenerate winners in Veo 3.1.
heroHighlights: Optimized for speed + business workflows||Built for programmatic ad generation and rapid creative testing at scale.
Keeps Veo‚Äôs cinematic intent||Clear camera language + style cues translate well into consistent variants.
Sound-ready drafts||Great for rough timing and vibe; polish the final take in the premium tier.
Simple upgrade path||Draft in Fast, then regenerate the keepers in Veo 3.1 for higher-fidelity finals.

custom.specTitle: Real Specs ‚Äì Veo 3.1 Fast in MaxVideoAI (720p/1080p, 4‚Äì8s)
custom.specNote: These specs describe Veo 3.1 Fast exactly as you can use it today via MaxVideoAI.

specSections.title: Draft-speed exploration
specSections.intro: Built for rapid testing and volume when you need ideas fast. Use it to explore hooks, angles, and pacing.
items: Promote winners to the full tier.

specSections.title: Upgrade path
specSections.intro: The same prompt structure upgrades cleanly to the premium tier. Treat Fast as your draft layer.
items: Use Fast for social drafts and loops.

custom.specValueProp: Veo 3.1 Fast is your rapid-fire test bench: same cinematic language as Veo 3.1, lower cost, faster turnaround.
custom.galleryTitle: Example Gallery: Real Veo 3.1 Fast Outputs
custom.galleryIntro: Explore clips generated with Veo 3.1 Fast using the same presets you have.
custom.imageIntro: Animate a single still into a quick loop or hero shot.
imageFlow: Upload a lifestyle or product photo.
Choose Image ‚Üí Video, duration (4/6/8 s), aspect ratio and resolution.
Prompt subtle camera and subject motion; add light audio or keep it silent.
Generate variants by changing one element at a time (camera speed, VO tone, time of day).
imageWhy: Quick hero shots for landing pages or ecommerce
Animated social posts from brand photography
Mood loops behind titles or UI elements
custom.multishotIntro1: Use Fast to explore prompts cheaply, then move winners to Veo 3.1.
custom.multishotIntro2: Framing and tone presets are shared, so migration is smooth.
multishotTips: Render 2‚Äì4 variants in Fast with small prompt tweaks.
Promote the best to Veo 3.1 for higher fidelity and audio depth.
Stay single-scene in Fast; use other Veo tiers for multi-beat control.
strengths: Lead with framing + camera move (wide/medium/close + dolly/pan/handheld) before style.
Keep one hero subject and one readable action per clip.
Use 2‚Äì3 concrete anchors (time of day, weather, 1‚Äì2 set details) instead of long lists.
For continuity, reuse the same ‚Äúshot recipe‚Äù (palette, lighting, lens feel) and change one variable per take.
Audio is best with minimal cues: ambience + 1 key sound, or one short VO line.
boundaries: Single-scene focus works best; multi-location narratives tend to drift.
This tier is draft-first (slightly less detail/fidelity than full Veo 3.1).
Tiny UI text and small lettering are unreliable ‚Äî add in post.
safetyRules: No sexual content, and nothing involving minors.
No hateful, harassing, or graphic-violence content.
Don‚Äôt impersonate real people or public figures; use consent for any likeness/voice.
Don‚Äôt include private personal data (addresses, phone numbers, documents, non-consenting faces).
Some prompts or references may be blocked by provider safety filters.
custom.comparisonTitle: Veo 3.1 Fast vs Veo 3.1 ‚Äì Quick Overview
comparisonPoints: Veo 3.1 Fast: cheaper, faster; best for tests, social loops, internal reviews.
Veo 3.1: higher fidelity and richer audio; best for client-ready and paid media.
Workflow: Prototype in Fast, then regenerate winners in Veo 3.1.

faqs.q: When should I use Veo 3.1 Fast instead of Veo 3.1?
faqs.a: Use Fast to explore ideas, social variants, and internal reviews; use Veo 3.1 for final hero shots and paid media.

faqs.q: Does Veo 3.1 Fast support vertical videos?
faqs.a: Yes‚Äî16:9 and 9:16 at 720p or 1080p; pick 9:16 for mobile-first placements.

faqs.q: Can I reuse Veo 3.1 prompts in Fast?
faqs.a: Yes. Clone a Veo 3.1 render, switch to Veo 3.1 Fast, keep framing/tone presets, tweak length/resolution.

faqs.q: How does pricing compare to Veo 3.1?
faqs.a: Fast is cheaper per second (e.g., ~$0.15/s audio on, ~$0.10/s audio off). Use it to try variants before upgrading.

faqs.q: Can I run Veo 3.1 Fast from Europe / LATAM?
faqs.a: Yes. Same MaxVideoAI wallet/workspace and licensed DeepMind routing‚Äîno separate billing.

custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Veo 3.1 Fast Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Veo Fast prefers short, concrete prompts and one clear action.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: duration + aspect ratio are set in the UI - your prompt controls subject, action, camera, lighting, style, and sound cues.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Call out framing and camera move.
Use 2-3 visual anchors, not long lists.
custom.tipsIntro: Veo 3.1 Fast is most reliable when you write a short shot brief: one subject, one action, clear framing, and one camera move.
promptingEngineWhy: Fast favors simple beats and short prompts.
Use style anchors to keep the look stable.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1‚Äì2 sentences when you want variations.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + one action.]

Context:
[Location + time + 2 visual anchors.]

Camera:
[Shot + angle + one move.]

Look:
[Lighting + palette + style.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1 cue.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Brief:
[Goal + vibe.]

Subject:
[Key traits + wardrobe/props.]

Camera:
[Framing + one move + lens feel.]

Lighting + color:
[Key light + palette anchors.]

Constraints:
Keep it simple; avoid extra actions.

promptingTabs.label: Storyboard
promptingTabs.title: Storyboard prompt (short shot list)
promptingTabs.description: Keep it minimal for faster, cleaner drafts.
promptingTabs.copy:
Shot list (same subject + same setting)
Duration: [4/6/8s]

Shot 1 (0-2s):
[Framing + action + camera move]

Shot 2 (2-6/8s):
[Framing + action + camera move]

Look + mood:
[Lighting + palette]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1 cue]

custom.demoTitle: Demo: prompt pattern for Veo 3.1 Fast
demoPrompt: 6s 9:16 loop of a young woman working late at a minimalist desk in front of a large window, city lights blurred.
Camera: slow handheld drift left/right, centered on her face and laptop.
Lighting: cool blue outside + warm lamp on hands.
Audio: soft typing, city hum, no dialogue.
demoNotes: One clear subject and one environment.
Audio supports the mood without adding complexity.
troubleshootingItems: Drift / ignores details ‚Üí move subject + action + framing to the first line; remove extra beats; keep constraints positive (‚Äúclean background‚Äù, ‚Äúcentered subject‚Äù).
Motion feels messy ‚Üí one camera move only; slow the action; simplify the background.
Off-brand look ‚Üí lock palette + lighting; reuse the same wording; add a reference frame when you can.
Text/signage breaks ‚Üí keep readable text off-screen; overlay critical copy in post.
VO / lip sync feels off ‚Üí shorten lines; avoid fast speech and long monologues.
